revised_title: Analysis of Photographic Arc Spectrum of Iron Meteorites
tldr: The author examines the photographic arc spectra of the Nejed and Obernkirchen meteorites and compares them to the solar spectrum. They identify the wavelengths, intensities, and origins of the lines in the spectra and determine the relative quantities of different substances present in the meteorites, concluding that the chief chemical difference between the two meteorites lies in the presence of calcium, nickel, barium, and strontium.
